meanings.definition: A device such as a pattern of letters, ideas, or associations that assists in remembering something.
meanings.sent1: Using mnemonics like acronyms can help me remember long lists of items.
meanings.sent2: She learned mnemonics in school to help her remember historical dates.
meanings.sent3: The clever mnemonics he created made studying for the test much more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mnemonic for remembering the order of the planets was like a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's mnemonic for remembering the colors of the rainbow was so easy to recall.

meanings.definition: The study and development of systems for improving and assisting the memory.
meanings.sent1: The class on mnemonics taught students different techniques to enhance memory.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in the field of mnemonics are always looking for new ways to boost memory retention.
meanings.sent3: His interest in mnemonics led him to create a memory palace out of his bedroom.
meanings.sent4: The art of mnemonics is like a toolbox full of memory-enhancing strategies.
meanings.sent5: The seminar on mnemonics was so informative that she felt her memory improving already.
